title: Use Material You Compat on Android 12+ if flag is enabled

body:
Some customization layers such as One UI or MIUI don't retrieve a meaningful color on wallpaper change (maybe this is just done on manual wallpaper selection, which kinda misses the purpose of automatic theming...), and on previous versions, for example, Android 11, still on One UI, this launcher shows more coherent colors most of the time.

This PR suggests a new settings flag under "Appearance" to ignore system colors on API 31+ and use same color quantization scheme for Android 8+, technically skipping the conditional that asks system its colors.

Could close #524 or related if it is merged.

Wit the refactor made for the settings data, integrate this flag onto migration classes no longer makes sense.
This PR was updated to reflect that.
